title: Sky Cinema movies November 2019: New releases and Christmas classics
text:
With civilisation falling apart around them, Anna and her friends must work out who they can still rely on in Anna and the Apocalypse (Picture: Supplied/Sky Cinema)

Sky Cinema have got a brand new selection of movies hitting their channel in November and new releases that will make you more than happy to curl up on the sofa and out of the cold as winter well and truly takes hold and the clocks go back.

With the build up to Halloween at the end of this month being replaced by the countdown to Christmas in November, Sky Cinema have a film that combines frightening flesh-eating zombies with a festive theme in their list of new premieres for November.

You can also expect Hollywood blockbusters, family-friendly films to keep the kids happy and an action-packed thriller sure to keep you on the edge of your seat until Santa arrives.

So what’s going to be on Sky Cinema for your cosy nights in as the days get darker and colder? Here are the new releases to look forward to from Sky in November 2019.

Sky Movies new releases – November 2019

Anna and the Apocalypse – November 1

It’s a Christmas movie, but not as you know it, as sixth-form student Anna and her friends must battle to save their home Little Haven from zombies when they strike just before Christmas.

Not as grisly as it sounds, this age 15 rated film is both a comedy and a horror movie – with musical numbers thrown in for good measure.



In Disney’s magical take on the classic The Nutcracker, Clara wants a one-of-a-kind key that will unlock a box holding a priceless gift. (Picture: Supplied/Sky Cinema)

The Nutcracker and the Four Realms – November 8

Keira Knightly and Mackenzie Foy of Twilight fame star together in this re-telling of the 1892 two-act ballet about a little girl who finds herself transported to a magical world where toys are alive and Nutcracker soldiers must fight evil mouse minions.

Featuring the same well-known score from the hugely popular ballet, Disney puts their own twist on the classic tale, creating a fantastical world of snowflakes, flowers and sweets to get lost in.

Gina Rodriguez stars as Gloria in Miss Bala. (Picture: Supplied/Sky Cinema)

Miss Bala – November 9

Starring actress Gina Rodriguez as Gloria, a beauty-pageant contestant who finds herself embroiled in a terrifying fight for survival with the Mexican cartel, this action thriller will have you on the edge of your seat.

Gloria’s world is turned upside down after her friend is kidnapped from a nightclub during a public shooting, but when she calls the police for help, things get even worse.



Little Monsters in not your average zombie flick. (Picture: Supplied/Sky Cinema)

Little Monsters – November 15

Another zombie flick with a twist in Sky Cinema’s offering for November, Little Monsters tells the story of a musician who teams up with a teacher and a kids’ show celebrity to protect a class of school kids from a sudden outbreak of zombies at a theme park.

The Australian movie stars Oscar-winner Lupita Nyong’o and is more comedy than blood-curdling horror.



Captain Marvel is an adventure from a previously unseen period in the history of the Marvel Cinematic Universe. (Picture: Supplied/Sky Cinema)

Captain Marvel – November 22

Brie Larson’s turn as an ass-kicking superhero in mega Marvel Studios’ blockbuster Captain Marvel joins the line-up of new movies on Sky Cinema this November.

Having only dropped in cinemas back in March 2019, Sky’s newest superhero title to join their channel gives fans a chance to re-watch the film about Captain Marvel, one of the universe’s greatest superheroes as she begins to untangle the link between her and a lost air force pilot named Carol Danvers.



Dumbo (2019) expands on the beloved classic where differences are celebrated, family is cherished and dreams take flight. (Picture: Supplied/Sky Cinema)

Dumbo – November 29

Another Disney film featuring on Sky’s line-up of new releases for November 2019 is their live-action remake of Dumbo.

Directed by Tim Burton and starring Colin Farrell, Michael Keaton and Danny Devito, this is a family-friendly film and an update re-make of the classic movie about a magical young elephant called Dumbo, who uses its oversized ears to fly. Tissues at the ready!

Sky Cinema’s new collections for November 2019 Sky Cinema also has some festive favourites and films that are five star standard in their movie collections for you to browse in November. The two new collections are sure to make nights in on the sofa something to look forward to as the nights draw in and will no doubt get you in the spirit of Christmas now the countdown has begun: Christmas collection – Available from November 2 until December 31 Highlights include: The Grinch, Die Hard, Arthur Christmas, It’s a Wonderful Life, The Muppet Christmas Carol, The Polar Express, Trading Places, Sleepless in Seattle Five Star Movies collection – Available from November 4 until November 17 Highlights include: Gone With The Wind, Jaws, The Graduate, Vertigo, Shawshank Redemption, A Clockwork Orange, The Dark Knight, Zulu, Forrest Gump
